definition: of a proposition whose truth value is determined by observation or facts, a compound made artificially by chemical reactions
details:
adjective
- of a proposition whose truth value is determined by observation or facts
= example: of a proposition whose truth value is determined by observation or facts
= synonyms: synthetical
- systematic combining of root and modifying elements into single words
- involving or of the nature of synthesis (combining separate elements to form a coherent whole) as opposed to analysis
= example: involving or of the nature of synthesis (combining separate elements to form a coherent whole) as opposed to analysis
= synonyms: synthetical
- not genuine or natural
= example: not genuine or natural
- artificial as if portrayed in a film
= synonyms: celluloid
- not of natural origin
= synonyms: man-made, semisynthetic
noun
- a compound made artificially by chemical reactions
= synonyms: synthetic substance
